question: Initial Project Submission
answer: Initial project submissions are due on Devpost by Sunday, February 2nd, 2025 at 10:30 AM EST. Judging preference forms are also due at this time. This can be a rough submission with random text, links, etc. You must submit your project to all the prize categories you'd like to be considered for.

question: Final Project Submission
answer:
Final project submissions are due by Sunday, February 2nd, 2025 at 12:30 PM EST including a 3-minute maximum demo video and link to a GitHub repo containing your code. All submissions will be made to the HackViolet 2025 Devpost page.
  • New to Devpost? Check out this submission guide.
  • Here is a video with tips on Devpost submission

question: Demo Video
answer:
All teams must submit a 3-min max. demo video along with their submission. Here are some tips:
  • The demo video must describe what your project is and how it works
  • Each team member should be speaking/present at least once in the video. Don’t just have one person explain it all!
  • Be creative! The judges will be looking at dozens of projects during the day, so you want to ensure the demo's first few seconds capture their attention!
  • Here are some examples of projects from HackViolet 2024.Take a look at the winners – do you notice anything in common?

question: Link to GitHub Repository
answer:
All teams must also include a link to a GitHub repository with your code.
  • It’s best to create your repository early and make commits as you go so that judges can see your progress!
  • New to GitHub? Check out these resources
